main event: A civilian pilot observed an unidentified flying object while flying from Montrose to Grand Junction, Colorado on May 15, 1953.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be approximately 30 feet in diameter and metallic in nature, reflecting sunlight., The object maintained a constant altitude of 7000 to 8000 feet and flew at a speed of 400 to 500 mph., The pilot visually tracked the object for approximately 10 minutes over a distance of 25 to 30 miles., The object made no abrupt turns or changes in speed or direction during the sighting., There were no photographs or physical evidence collected related to the sighting.
witness description: civilian pilot during a training flight
